page.title: 10FARM MACHINERY
page.content: In 1985 the farmer has many machines to help him. He has the tractor which is now highly developed for work and safety and can be up to 200 Horse Power. There are many attachments for the tractor - ploughs to turn over the soil, bogeys used for carrying, harrowers to cultivate the soil and cover seeds, rollers to compress the earth, sprayers to kill weeds and promote growth, sowing machines to plant seeds, mowers to cut hay and silage, turnip harvesters to lift turnips, balers to compress straw or hay into bundles and machines for lifting out stones. The farmer uses a combine harvester to harvest the crops. This machine cuts and dresses which means separating the grain from the straw. The grain is then poured into a cart and stored in a granary where it is heat dried.
